intro: Trichodesma paktiense, commonly known as the Paktiense false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Pakistan. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the spring and summer seasons. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
